isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not scratch gasket surface of cylinder head.

step1.para: With valves installed to protect seats, use a scraper and wire brush to remove deposits and gasket material from valve heads and gasket surface.
Use a suitable solvent to remove dirt, grease, and deposits from removed parts.
Clean all bolt holes. Make sure gasket surfaces, oil return, and coolant passages are clean. After rinsing thoroughly with hot water, dry with filtered compressed air.
Clean all bolts (except head bolts) with a suitable solvent and dry thoroughly. New head bolts must be installed.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, clean and dry threads in crankcase bolt holes with filtered compressed air. Dirt or oil in holes may cause binding and incorrect torque readings.

step1.para: Clean crankcase threads with compressed air.

Use Cylinder Head Bolt Tap ZTSE4744
to clean each tapped hole in crankcase top deck. Remove debris with filtered compressed air.
Thoroughly clean push rods with a suitable solvent. Dry with filtered compressed air.
